content:
• Thursday, June 6, 2013
  • CMTL

    More on Comtech Telecom (NASDAQ:CMTL): FQ3 comes in mixed, coming up short on revenue but...

    More on Comtech Telecom (NASDAQ:CMTL): FQ3 comes in mixed, coming up short on revenue but solidly beating on a per share basis. Net earnings fell 53% as a 30% Y/Y decline in total sales was felt across several businesses lines. The company also lowered its FY13 revenue outlook by $10M, now seeing $310M to $320M, but ups the lower end of its earnings guidance by $0.06 a share to $0.86 to $0.92 a share, reflecting increased share buybacks. Shares +3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 PM
  • IRM

    Some others taking hit in the post-session on Iron Mountain's (NYSE:IRM) IRS REIT conversion...

    Some others taking hit in the post-session on Iron Mountain's (NYSE:IRM) IRS REIT conversion news: Lamar Advertising (LAMR -7.7%) and Penn National Gaming (PENN -1.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 7:47 PM
  • MDGL

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA) regains a big chunk in post-trading of what it lost during the...

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA) regains a big chunk in post-trading of what it lost during the regular session, after CEO Safi R. Bahcall discloses the purchase of 10K shares at $4.40. The insider buy follows the 70% hit the stock took following survival results from its Phase 2b/3 trial of Ganetespib presented at as ASCO last week. In addition to Bahcall's purchase, Director and larger shareholder Bruce Kovner also recently disclosed the purchase of 2M shares. Shares +4.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • MSFT

    Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) won't charge a fee for Xbox One used game sales to "retailers,...

    Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) won't charge a fee for Xbox One used game sales to "retailers, publishers, or consumers," the company states in a blog post. GameStop (NYSE:GME) investors are relieved, shares +5% AH. Other details: 1) With games/data stored in the cloud, users will be able to access owned games on friends' consoles by logging in. 2) Users are required to be online once every 24 hours on their home console, and once an hour on a friend's console, to verify usage rights. 3) Games can be shared with up to 10 family members, who can play them on any console (though only one can play from a shared library at a given time). (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 PM | 3 Comments
  • MTN

    More on Vail Resorts (NYSE:MTN): FQ3 misses across the board despite an 11% Y/Y jump in total...

    More on Vail Resorts (NYSE:MTN): FQ3 misses across the board despite an 11% Y/Y jump in total sales. Net earnings rose 23% as the ski-resort operator reported strong revenue growth out of its core skiing operations. Mountain segment revenue was up 13%, as revenue from lift tickets, ski school, retail and equipment rental all improved. Dining revenue was also up 21%. Spring pass sales for the coming year climbed 24%, while unit growth was 18%. Shares -4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 PM
  • IPGP

    IPG Photonics (IPGP +4.9%) closed up strongly after CFO Tim Mammen provided an upbeat talk...

    IPG Photonics (IPGP +4.9%) closed up strongly after CFO Tim Mammen provided an upbeat talk (transcript) at BofA/Merrill's tech conference. Mammen calmed investors on edge over macro by stating Chinese orders "continued to be strong through the end of April and ... order flow around the world has continued to be pretty strong through the end of May." He also talked up the growth of the fiber laser market (20%+ estimated CAGR from 2011-2015) and the value of IPG's vertical integration (lower costs, more control over product development), and said IPG plans to launch its first UV laser (aided by the Mobius Photonics deal) within 6 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • JRCCQ

    James River Coal (JRCC) -14.3% AH after filing for a public offering of ~24.6M shares of its...

    James River Coal (JRCC) -14.3% AH after filing for a public offering of ~24.6M shares of its common stock, all of which will be offered by selling shareholders. JRCC will receive no proceeds from the offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • CCUR

    Concurrent (OTC:CCUR) moves up in post-session trade after the global video, media data...

    Concurrent (OTC:CCUR) moves up in post-session trade after the global video, media data intelligence and real-time Linux solutions provider doubles its dividend payout from $0.06 to $0.12. Shares +8.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • CCUR

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: OTC:CCUR +9%. AYR +8%. ANAD +6%. RLD +5%. TRN +5%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: OTC:CCUR +9%. AYR +8%. ANAD +6%. RLD +5%. TRN +5%.
    After-hours top losers: BV-OLD -13%. MKTG -11%. JRCC -10%. TIVO -8%. ACHN -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZQK

    More on Quicksilver (NYSE:ZQK): FQ2 misses on all counts as total sales fell 7% Y/Y. Gross...

    More on Quicksilver (NYSE:ZQK): FQ2 misses on all counts as total sales fell 7% Y/Y. Gross margin fell to 46% from 49.2% as the company discounted its merchandise to clear inventory. Shares -10% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • IRM

    Iron Mountain (NYSE:IRM) -11.3% after disclosing the IRS is "tentatively adverse" to providing a...

    Iron Mountain (NYSE:IRM) -11.3% after disclosing the IRS is "tentatively adverse" to providing a favorable private letter ruling regarding its conversion to a REIT, and that the agency has "formed a new internal working group" to study legal standards for what constitutes "real estate" for the purposes of REIT conversion. Equinix (NASDAQ:EQIX), which is also planning to become a REIT, is down 2.9%. Update (5:56): The losses steepen: IRM now -15% AH, EQIX -8.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • XIDEQ

    Exide Technologies (XIDE -16.3%) is preparing to file for potential bankruptcy protection by...

    Exide Technologies (XIDE -16.3%) is preparing to file for potential bankruptcy protection by this summer, WSJ reports. Any filing likely wouldn't include XIDE's European operations, which account for more than half the company's revenues. XIDE carries ~$700M in debt, and there's concern it won't be able to repay a ~$56M convertible note due in September.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 9 Comments
  • LDK

    LDK Solar (NYSE:LDK) -3.6% AH to $1.35 after announcing shareholders signed off on the sale of...

    LDK Solar (NYSE:LDK) -3.6% AH to $1.35 after announcing shareholders signed off on the sale of 25M shares to Fulai Investments for $1.03 apiece. The sale will only go a small way towards dealing with LDK's giant debt load. (PR) (bond default)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • MON

    Monsanto (NYSE:MON) has approved a $2B, new three-year share repurchase program. The new program...

    Monsanto (NYSE:MON) has approved a $2B, new three-year share repurchase program. The new program will commence at the completion of Monsanto's existing $1 billion share repurchase program, which was effective beginning in July 2012. Shares +0.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • AGNC

    With interest rate fears subsiding until at least 8:30 tomorrow morning, mREITs (MORT +1.9%) get...

    With interest rate fears subsiding until at least 8:30 tomorrow morning, mREITs (MORT +1.9%) get a breather. Leading higher were American Capital (AGNC +3.4%), (MTGE +1.1%), Chimera (CIM +2.7%), Hatteras (HTS +2.4%), CYS Investments (CYS +1.9%), Javelin (JMI +4.7%), and Annaly (NLY +1.9%). One theme from conference presentations this week: Most have taken advantage of widening spreads to buy - if rates come in, they're set to profit.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 11 Comments
  • MDGL

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA) has another tough day, falling 5.86% in regular trading, even as...

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA) has another tough day, falling 5.86% in regular trading, even as CEO Dr. Safi Bahcall gives what might fairly be described as an upbeat presentation at the Jefferies Global Healthcare Conference on the ongoing GALAXY trials for ganetespib (webcast). Despite company rhetoric, the market seems to be laser-focused on an increased Hazard ratio from one study to the next (I, II), something which has weighed heavily on the shares all week.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 3 Comments
  • COO

    The Cooper Cos. (NYSE:COO) FQ2 comes in mixed, beating on a per share basis but comes up shy on...

    The Cooper Cos. (NYSE:COO) FQ2 comes in mixed, beating on a per share basis but comes up shy on revenue. Total revenue rose 11% year-over-year, with CooperVision revenue up 7% and CooperSurgical up 32%. Gross margin rose to 66% from 64% in the prior year period. Looking forward, the company raises FY13 EPS guidance from $5.95 - $6.10 to $6.15 - $6.25. The Street is projecting $6.05. It lowers its FY13 sales outlook however, from $1.58B - $1.63B to $1.57B - $1.60B. Shares +2.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • ZQK

    Quiksilver (NYSE:ZQK): FQ2 EPS of -$0.12 misses by $0.16. Revenue of $459M misses by $46.36M....

    Quiksilver (NYSE:ZQK): FQ2 EPS of -$0.12 misses by $0.16. Revenue of $459M misses by $46.36M. Shares -9.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • TIVO

    More on TiVo: Susquehanna reports TiVo (TIVO +8.5%) and Motorola Mobility have settled....

    More on TiVo: Susquehanna reports TiVo (TIVO +8.5%) and Motorola Mobility have settled. Tomorrow's court hearing is reportedly cancelled. No word yet on deal terms. Update: "A clerk in the trial judge's chambers" tells Bloomberg a settlement has been reached. Update 2: TiVo also confirms the settlement.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • FCX

    Freeport McMoRan (FCX +2.3%) Vice Chairman James Flores sees better times ahead after FCX's...

    Freeport McMoRan (FCX +2.3%) Vice Chairman James Flores sees better times ahead after FCX's purchase of Plains Exploration; this week he bought an impressive 1.1M shares (~$34.2M). But Jefferies analyst Peter Ward, even as he reiterates a Buy rating and $40 target price on FCX, slams the sale as offering "no operational synergies."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 3 Comments
  • ISS

    iSoftStone Holdings (ISS +7.9%) soars after the board receives a letter from a consortium led by...

    iSoftStone Holdings (ISS +7.9%) soars after the board receives a letter from a consortium led by CEO Tianwen Liu and ChinaAMC Capital offering to acquire all of the outstanding shares (including ADSs) for $5.85/share. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • TIVO

    TiVo (TIVO +7.2%) has soared over the last 15 minutes on rumors a settlement has been reached...

    TiVo (TIVO +7.2%) has soared over the last 15 minutes on rumors a settlement has been reached with Motorola Mobility. Past estimates for a price tag have at least gone well into nine figures. TiVo and Motorola have been set to face off in court this month.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • OME

    Omega Protein (OME -12.8%) posts double-digit losses two days after reaching an agreement with...

    Omega Protein (OME -12.8%) posts double-digit losses two days after reaching an agreement with the U.S. Attorney's Office to pay a total of $7.5M in fines to resolve issues related to two violations of the Clean Water Act. Perhaps helping to tip sentiment to the downside today is an article from SA contributor LongShort101 who says the company's EBITDA could be cut in half once the depleted supply of Peruvian fish meal recovers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 2 Comments
  • MNK

    Cadence Pharmaceuticals (CADX +1%) moves higher today, despite a tepid initiation by Piper with...

    Cadence Pharmaceuticals (CADX +1%) moves higher today, despite a tepid initiation by Piper with a Neutral rating and a price target of $7. Piper notes that its survey of nearly three dozen surgeons showed the vast majority using a multi-modal approach to post operative pain. Half of those we polled are already using Ofirmev, and over a third of those polled are planning to use Ofirmev more frequently in the next 6-12 months. Given this feedback, Piper believs U.S. sales projections are realistic.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • NRG

    NRG Energy (NRG +1.7%) says it exceeded its post-merger goals for balance sheet...

    NRG Energy (NRG +1.7%) says it exceeded its post-merger goals for balance sheet efficiencies through a successful repricing of its senior credit facilities and increasing them to $2.5B from $2.3B, plus the previously announced redemption of GenOn's senior notes. NRG expects $49M/year in interest savings beginning in 2014 from the transactions.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • SBGL

    Sibayne Gold (SBGL +12.5%) soars after receiving a Goldman Sachs upgrade to Neutral, but Goldman...

    Sibayne Gold (SBGL +12.5%) soars after receiving a Goldman Sachs upgrade to Neutral, but Goldman is hardly ga-ga for South African miners, noting tough operating conditions, key unions competing for membership, and U.S. gold prices remaining relatively low. The weak rand has given the stocks a short-term boost but could create problems down the road, leaving AngloGold (NYSE:AU) most vulnerable, Goldman adds.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • FRAN

    Mired in a post-earnings sell-off, shares of Francesca's (FRAN -9.1%) aren't getting any help...

    Mired in a post-earnings sell-off, shares of Francesca's (FRAN -9.1%) aren't getting any help from Goldman analyst Lindsay Drucker Mann who notes that Q1 comps growth of 2% (previous), was well short of guidance and is "another in a string of sequential comp decelerations on a two-year basis over the last five quarters." "Can you give details on traffic vs. conversion in terms of the composition of your comps for Q1?" she asks on the CC. "Lindsay, it was flat and all metrics were generally flat … and so, it was generally of a flat character," CEO Neill Davis responds. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • REGN

    Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +7.6%) takes another leg higher, breaking out on the back of...

    Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +7.6%) takes another leg higher, breaking out on the back of news posted earlier of positive top-line results for Eylea.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • MNST

    All that talk about Coca-Cola or PepsiCo buying SodaStream appears to be helping to lift shares...

    All that talk about Coca-Cola or PepsiCo buying SodaStream appears to be helping to lift shares of Monster Beverage (MNST +1.8%) on some speculation that it could be a target itself. Once upon a time, the beverage giants were rumored to be in the hunt for Monster in the $80 range, but since then regulatory concerns have taken some of the pop out of the Monster story. Belarus Capital warns the FDA may have more to say on the energy drink issue later this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • SJM

    "Talk amongst yourselves." Deutsche Bank sees too much coffee talk surrounding J.M. Smucker's...

    "Talk amongst yourselves." Deutsche Bank sees too much coffee talk surrounding J.M. Smucker's (SJM -4.1%) quarterly report: "The shares tend to be volatile around results as investors fixated on coffee either feel a caffeine high or overly depressed," analyst Eric Katzman says, reiterating a Buy rating and a price target of $109. The bottom line for Katzman: SJM's story is based on "leading brands, share gains, productivity, and a solid balance sheet." (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • BA

    Boeing (BA +1%) updates its Orders & Deliveries page today, saying it's posted seven new...

    Boeing (BA +1%) updates its Orders & Deliveries page today, saying it's posted seven new orders for 737s from unidentified customers since last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • CBAK-OLD

    China Bak Battery (CBAK-OLD -16.8%) plummets after SA contributor Richard Pearson decides to...

    China Bak Battery (CBAK-OLD -16.8%) plummets after SA contributor Richard Pearson decides to call the company and ask about reports that it would be supplying lithium-ion batteries to Kandi Technologies (KNDI -1.1%). Unfortunately for shareholders, the rumor turned out to be just that, as CBAK says they aren't doing any business with KNDI. (See also: Pearson's 2012 article on CBAK)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • HOLX

    Shares of Hologic (HOLX +1.9%) pop after the company announces a deal with Quest Diagnostics...

    Shares of Hologic (HOLX +1.9%) pop after the company announces a deal with Quest Diagnostics (DGX +0.1%) to expand access to APTIMA-based testing and to jointly develop diagnostic solutions to promote women's health. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • ESC

    Emeritus (ESC -3.2%) slips today after Goldman Sachs initiated the shares with a less than...

    Emeritus (ESC -3.2%) slips today after Goldman Sachs initiated the shares with a less than sellar Neutral rating and a $29 price target. Goldman says that, despite being a solid operator in a challenging environment over the past couple of years, the company's high leverage could prove to be a hindrance. In addition, favorable trends such as demographics, limited new supply, pricing discipline, and high private payer mix may be slower to materialize.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • BIOL

    Biolase (BIOL -3.6%) falls after issuing a statement regarding rumors about CEO Federico...

    Biolase (BIOL -3.6%) falls after issuing a statement regarding rumors about CEO Federico Pignatelli's future with the company: "There is absolutely no truth to rumors that Federico Pignatelli, Chairman and CEO, would resign from the Board or the Company," BIOL says. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • AVDL

    Flamel Technologies (FLML +1.5%) bucks a weak tape today after saying it's signed a multi-year...

    Flamel Technologies (FLML +1.5%) bucks a weak tape today after saying it's signed a multi-year development partnership agreement with an undisclosed, large international pharmaceutical company. The development work, which will be done in Flamel's Bordeaux facility in France, is expected to generate revenue of over $4M over the next several years, and could be expanded.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • POWR

    PowerSecure International (POWR +6.6%) says it's added $75M to its revenue backlog, including...

    PowerSecure International (POWR +6.6%) says it's added $75M to its revenue backlog, including about $49M from a renewed and expanded three year utility infrastructure award to serve one of the nation's largest investor owned utilities. The new contract represents an increase of approximately 50% over last year's work levels. Additionally, the new business awards include around $18M of new distributed generation business, $4M of additional new utility infrastructure business, and about $4M in new energy efficiency sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • TEVA

    Shares of NuPathe (PATH -1%) are lower again today, extending a week-long decline on no specific...

    Shares of NuPathe (PATH -1%) are lower again today, extending a week-long decline on no specific news. The stock took an accelerated turn to the downside in early trading, cratering nearly 14% on what looks like capitulation selling before recovering most of the losses.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • OSHWQ

    Midday top 10 gainers: OSH +29%. SKBI +25%. MEG +23%. RDCM +19%. TRUE +16%. NPTN +13%. CIEN...

    Midday top 10 gainers: OSH +29%. SKBI +25%. MEG +23%. RDCM +19%. TRUE +16%. NPTN +13%. CIEN +13%. TRMD-OLD +13%. MY +12%. FSGI +11%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: PAY -19%. CBAK-OLD -15%. SNTA -14%. CWTR -13%. GIG -12%. ASNA -11%. RST -10%. VRA -10%. FRAN -9%. YOD -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM

  • Unusual given past patterns, the dollar (UUP -1.7%) is being unloaded across the board and in...

    Unusual given past patterns, the dollar (UUP -1.7%) is being unloaded across the board and in size along with stocks selling off. The euro (FXE +1.5%), cable (FXB +1.8%), the yen (FXY +3.1%), the aussie (FXA +1.1%), and the loonie (FXC +1.3%) are all sharply higher vs. the greenback. The Dow's now off 86 points.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 14 Comments
  • DVN

    Devon Energy (DVN -2.5%) shares aren't benefiting from plans to form an MLP that will initially...

    Devon Energy (DVN -2.5%) shares aren't benefiting from plans to form an MLP that will initially own a minority stake in the U.S. midstream business, as UBS reminds investors that DVN’s free cash flow deficit will total ~$2B this year and next. Today's plunge in natural gas prices surely isn't helping; ~60% of DVN’s reserves are natural gas.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • MKTG

    Responsys (MKTG +7.4%) continues to surge as investors bet Salesforce's purchase of marketing...

    Responsys (MKTG +7.4%) continues to surge as investors bet Salesforce's purchase of marketing automation rival ExactTarget (which follows Oracle's purchase of Eloqua) will make the company a target. Baird's Steven Ashley: “Large companies are trying to put together more complete suites and offerings of digital marketing services ... There could be other activity." SAP's plans for e-commerce software firm hybris also seem to drive Ashley's point home. While Responsys jumps, Marketo (MKTO -7.4%) is now down 21% since Salesofrce/ExactTarget was announced, as investors worry about Salesforce's plans to cross-sell ExactTarget's software.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • SNOA

    Oculus Innovative Sciences (OCLS -4%) slips this morning, despite an earlier announcement that...

    Oculus Innovative Sciences (OCLS -4%) slips this morning, despite an earlier announcement that it had inked an agreement to establish licensing and supply, as well as shared services, with its wholly owned subsidiary, Ruthigen. They will focus on the discovery, development, and commercialization of pharmaceutical-grade hypochlorous acid-based therapeutics. The company expects to negotiate a third agreement governing other terms of their business relationship in the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • MU

    Stifel raises its FQ3 and FQ4 revenue forecasts for Micron (MU +2.6%) ahead of its June 19 FQ3...

    Stifel raises its FQ3 and FQ4 revenue forecasts for Micron (MU +2.6%) ahead of its June 19 FQ3 report, driving shares to new 52-week highs. The firm points out DRAM and NAND flash remain healthy, and thinks they could stay that way well into 2014. The comments come shortly after DRAMeXchange predicted NAND sales will grow 27% in 2013 on the back of 49% bit growth. Micron rival SanDisk (SNDK +0.8%) is slightly higher; the company recently updated its consumer/PC solid-state drive line, adding new high-performance and small-form-factor drives that feature NAND chips using SanDisk's advanced 19nm process.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • THC

    More interesting tidbits from Deutsche Bank's upgrade of Tenet Healthcare (THC +2.1%): Analyst...

    More interesting tidbits from Deutsche Bank's upgrade of Tenet Healthcare (THC +2.1%): Analyst Darren Lehrich (who spoke with management) says THC did not rule out "large-scale M&A (acquiring other investor-owned chains)," fueling some speculation about a deal for Health Management Associates (HMA +0.8%). A nice thought perhaps, but Lehrich says THC noted its recent strategy of "divesting rural assets," something HMA has a lot of.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • CG

    There's more cashing in of chips (previous) in the P-E sector with Carlyle (CG -2.5%) pricing an...

    There's more cashing in of chips (previous) in the P-E sector with Carlyle (CG -2.5%) pricing an 11M share secondary of units offered by CalPERS at $27 each. CalPERS no longer owns a stake in Carlyle after having been an investor since 2001. The stock is up 34% since its IPO about a year ago. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • BLRX

    BioLineRx (BLRX +1.3%) says it's enrolled the first patient in a Phase 2 trial for BL-8040, for...

    BioLineRx (BLRX +1.3%) says it's enrolled the first patient in a Phase 2 trial for BL-8040, for the treatment of acute myeloid leukemia. In addition to receiving regulatory approval for commencing the trial in the U.S.this past April, it recently received regulatory approval from the Israeli Ministry of Health to conduct the trial in Israel as well. The activation of Israeli sites is anticipated during the next few weeks.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • XONE

    Canaccord's Bobby Burleson starts coverage on ExOne (XONE +5.6%) with a Buy and $55 PT: he sees...

    Canaccord's Bobby Burleson starts coverage on ExOne (XONE +5.6%) with a Buy and $55 PT: he sees the 3D printer maker benefiting from the adoption of new materials such as titanium, and sees long-term growth fueled by the migration of industrial clients "from low-unit-volume evaluation phase to higher-unit-volume production," as well as by rising production service center use. SA Pro contributor Brian Smith, Jr. recently offered a more bearish take. 3D printer vendors are once more moving as a group: DDD +3%. SSYS +1.6%. Though clocked last month thanks to a Q1 miss and light guidance, ExOne is still up 150% from its Feb. IPO price of $18.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 3 Comments

  • Europe turns decidedly lower, the Stoxx 50 now off 0.8% following Mario Draghi's press...

    Europe turns decidedly lower, the Stoxx 50 now off 0.8% following Mario Draghi's press conference, with markets perhaps deciding to punish his somewhat smug performance: "OMT has probably been the most successful monetary measure for some time." - a curious statement considering it doesn't yet exist and Draghi admitted the legal paperwork isn't complete. Leading to the downside is Italy (EWI), tumbling 2.3%. The euro (FXE) continues to rise, +0.7% to $1.3182.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • LRE

    LRR Energy (LRE +7.9%) is surging after issuing a Q2 operating update: LRE estimates...

    LRR Energy (LRE +7.9%) is surging after issuing a Q2 operating update: LRE estimates average net production for the two months ended May 31 was ~6,450 boe/day, and reaffirms FY 2013 operating guidance of 6,250-6,550 boe/day. Wells Fargo upgrades shares to Outperform with a $17 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • UNG

    Natural gas (UNG -3.2%) goes whoosh as EIA data shows an unexpectedly large 111bcf build in...

    Natural gas (UNG -3.2%) goes whoosh as EIA data shows an unexpectedly large 111bcf build in stockpiles. Gas is off about 14% since the start of May as late spring temps have been cooler than normal.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • ASNA

    Ascena Retail Group (ASNA -10.3%) slides after its Q3 results miss on both the top and bottom...

    Ascena Retail Group (ASNA -10.3%) slides after its Q3 results miss on both the top and bottom line. From the report: Comps growth comes in negative (-1%) and would have been worse (-4%) were it not for a 37% Y/Y increase in e-commerce sales. CEO David Jaffe attributes "soft" top line performance to the usual suspects: unseasonably cold weather and "economic challenges." Outlook: the company sees FY13 EPS of $1.10-1.15 versus consensus of $1.26. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +1.8%) says data published on two of its trials in the June 6...

    LightInTheBox (NYSE:LITB) delivers a strong IPO. After pricing its 8.3M-share offering at $9.50,...

    LightInTheBox (NYSE:LITB) delivers a strong IPO. After pricing its 8.3M-share offering at $9.50, shares opened at $11.16 and have quickly shot higher to $12.05, good for a 26.8% gain. That gives the Chinese online retailer a valuation of $1.18B, or 5.9x 2012 sales. LightInTheBox posted Q1 revenue of $73.3M (+99% Y/Y), and net income of $1.7M; its gross margin was an impressive 45.4%, or 40.2% if one counts fulfillment costs. Though the company competes with Chinese e-commerce giants Alibaba and 360buy, 64.7% and 19.8% of Q1 sales respectively came from Europe and North America. (F-1) (IPO preview)
